title: Signs you are self-sabotaging your relationship
text:
Next Story : 9 ethnic styles you should try this festive season

Relationships need hard work. Period. There can be several patches of rough weather. You might blame circumstances or your partner for everything that is going wrong in your relationship. Before you start apportioning the blame, sometimes you need to look inward as well. Maybe you are sabotaging your own relationship! How do you know? Look for these red flags.You say you are committed to the relationship. Your bae has removed himself from all dating apps. But you do dilly-dally for a considerable stretch of time. In fact, you continue checking profiles on the sly.No matter who's at fault, you always find a way of portraying yourself as the wronged party in the relationship, if issues crop up. That can sometimes be construed as being selfish and manipulative.During fights, do you have a tendency to question his reality? In other words, do you always end up saying, 'You're crazy.' Beware, you could be self-sabotaging your relationship by gaslighting him.You are always thinking the worst about him. You are always doubting him - in fact, you find yourself trapped in a vicious cycle of blame and doubt. You are so enmeshed in this cycle of paranoia that you are totally blind to how this is sabotaging your relationship.
description: Sometimes things can awry in your relationship because you have stopped looking inward. In other words, are you self-sabotaging your relationship?
